A

addScore(String, int) - Method in class HighScoreManager
Method that loads the scores file, adds a new username and its score to the ArrayList score and updates the file
Answer - Class in <Unnamed>
Answer Class - coloured words that represents the possible answers extends Node so that it can be converted to Node and added to Pane (displayed via JavaFx)
Answer(int, int, int, int, int) - Constructor for class Answer
Constructor of Answer Class
avatar - Variable in class Player
 

B

backButton - Static variable in class InstructionsScene
 
backButton - Static variable in class LeaderBoardScene
 
backRectangle() - Method in class GameOver
Method that creates the background for the game over sign and exit route

C

checkLevel() - Method in class GameApp
Method that checks whether number of correct answers is enough to increase level of game
color - Variable in class Answer
 
colorName - Variable in class Answer
 
compare(Score, Score) - Method in class ScoreComparator
Method used to compare two scores
createAnswer() - Method in class Answer
Method that sets the text and colour of an answer
createGreenAvatar() - Method in class Player
Method that draws a polygon given the coordinates and other characteristics
createInstructions() - Method in class InstructionsScene
Method that creates a new Pane and adds an image background, the instructions obtained from a text file and a button to it
createInstructions() - Method in class LeaderBoardScene
Method that creates a new Pane and adds to it an image background, the ranking with username and score, and a button
createLife() - Method in class Life
Method that loads the heart image and defines its graphic properties
createMenu() - Method in class MenuScene
Method that creates a new Pane and adds the following graphic components to it: background image, game name and menu buttons
createQuestion() - Method in class Question
Method used to define characteristics of question
createRedAvatar() - Method in class Player
Method that draws a polygon given the coordinates and other characteristics

E

exitRoute() - Method in class GameOver
Method that creates a text which shows the user how to quit the game

G

GameApp - Class in <Unnamed>
GameApp Class - launches the game via menu and sets the different scenes extends Application so that it runs JavaFx
GameApp() - Constructor for class GameApp
 
GameApp.MenuBox - Class in <Unnamed>
MenuBox Class - dedicated to creating layout of buttons extends VBox, responsible for setting layout of items vertically
GameApp.MenuItem - Class in <Unnamed>
MenuItem Class - Creates the graphics of each button and sets its mouse events
GameOver - Class in <Unnamed>
GameOver Class - creates the background where the game over sign and exit route will be displayed extends StackPane so that it can create a single object made of different components (Rectangle and Text) and allow it to be added to root
GameOver() - Constructor for class GameOver
Constructor of GameOver that creates and adds together the game over sign, the exit route and their background
gameOver() - Method in class GameOver
Method that creates text which displays the sign GAME OVER
getCorrectSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when user chooses a correct answer
getGameOverSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when the game is over
getHighscoreString() - Method in class HighScoreManager
Method that runs through the ArrayList scores and return each element individually
getLastLifeSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when the user has only one life remaining
getScore() - Method in class Score
Method used to obtain score value
getScores() - Method in class HighScoreManager
Method responsible for calling methods that load and sort the scores
getSelectSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when user makes a selection
getStartSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when the game starts
getStartUpSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when the program starts
getUserName() - Method in class Score
Method used to obtain username
getWrongSound() - Method in class Sounds
Method that gets the sound played when user chooses a wrong answer

Score - Class in <Unnamed>
Score Class - responsible for storing the username and its score implements Serializable

Constructor that assigns received values to Score class
ScoreBoard - Class in <Unnamed>
ScoreBoard Class - creates the text "SCORE" and the score (value) itself extends StackPane so that it can create a single object made of more than one component (2 Texts) and allow it to be added to root

Constructor of GameOver that creates and adds together the text score and the score value

ScoreComparator Class - used for comparing scores and returning the outcome of this comparison

start(Stage) - is launched by main
